detaileddescription.para: maximum packet size (MPS) for EP 0
full speed MPS for bulk EP
full speed MPS for interrupt EP
full speed MPS for isochronous EP

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* usb_ep_callback) (uint8_t ep, enum usb_dc_ep_cb_status_code cb_status)
memberdef.name: usb_ep_callback

briefdescription.para: Callback function signature for the USB Endpoint status.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* usb_request_handler) (struct usb_setup_packet *setup, int32_t *transfer_len, uint8_t **payload_data)
memberdef.name: usb_request_handler

briefdescription.para: Callback function signature for class specific requests.

detaileddescription.para: Function which handles Class specific requests corresponding to an interface number specified in the device descriptor table. For host to device direction the 'len' and 'payload_data' contain the length of the received data and the pointer to the received data respectively. For device to host class requests, 'len' and 'payload_data' should be set by the callback function with the length and the address of the data to be transmitted buffer respectively.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* usb_interface_config) (struct usb_desc_header *head, uint8_t bInterfaceNumber)
memberdef.name: usb_interface_config

briefdescription.para: Function for interface runtime configuration.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* usb_transfer_callback) (uint8_t ep, int tsize, void *priv)
memberdef.name: usb_transfer_callback

detaileddescription.para: Callback function signature for transfer completion.

briefdescription.para: Configure USB controller.

detaileddescription.para: Function to configure USB controller. Configuration parameters must be valid or an error is returned

parameterdescription.para: USB descriptor table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail

briefdescription.para: Deconfigure USB controller.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the USB device to it's initial state

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail

briefdescription.para: Enable the USB subsystem and associated hardware.

detaileddescription.para: This function initializes the USB core subsystem and enables the corresponding hardware so that it can begin transmitting and receiving on the USB bus, as well as generating interrupts.
Class-specific initialization and registration must be performed by the user before invoking this, so that any data or events on the bus are processed correctly by the associated class handling code.

parameterdescription.para: Callback registered by user to notify about USB device controller state.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Disable the USB device.

detaileddescription.para: Function to disable the USB device. Upon success, the specified USB interface is clock gated in hardware, it is no longer capable of generating interrupts.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t ep, const uint8_t *data, uint32_t data_len, uint32_t *bytes_ret)
memberdef.name: usb_write

briefdescription.para: Write data to the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: Function to write data to the specified endpoint. The supplied usb_ep_callback will be called when transmission is done.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Pointer to data to write
Length of data requested to write. This may be zero for a zero length status packet.
Bytes written to the EP FIFO. This value may be NULL if the application expects all bytes to be written

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail

briefdescription.para: Read data from the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called by the Endpoint handler function, after an OUT interrupt has been received for that EP. The application must only call this function through the supplied usb_ep_callback function.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Pointer to data buffer to write to
Max length of data to read
Number of bytes read. If data is NULL and max_data_len is 0 the number of bytes available for read is returned.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail

briefdescription.para: Set STALL condition on the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called by USB device class handler code to set stall condition on endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail

briefdescription.para: Clears STALL condition on the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called by USB device class handler code to clear stall condition on endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail

briefdescription.para: Read data from the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: This is similar to usb_ep_read, the difference being that, it doesn't clear the endpoint NAKs so that the consumer is not bogged down by further upcalls till he is done with the processing of the data. The caller should reactivate ep by invoking usb_ep_read_continue() do so.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
pointer to data buffer to write to
max length of data to read
Number of bytes read. If data is NULL and max_data_len is 0 the number of bytes available for read should be returned.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Continue reading data from the endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: Clear the endpoint NAK and enable the endpoint to accept more data from the host. Usually called after usb_ep_read_wait() when the consumer is fine to accept more data. Thus these calls together acts as flow control mechanism.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Transfer management endpoint callback.

detaileddescription.para: If a USB class driver wants to use high-level transfer functions, driver needs to register this callback as usb endpoint callback.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t ep, uint8_t *data, size_t dlen, unsigned int flags, usb_transfer_callback cb, void *priv)
memberdef.name: usb_transfer

briefdescription.para: Start a transfer.

detaileddescription.para: Start a usb transfer to/from the data buffer. This function is asynchronous and can be executed in IRQ context. The provided callback will be called on transfer completion (or error) in thread context.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Pointer to data buffer to write-to/read-from
Size of data buffer
Transfer flags (USB_TRANS_READ, USB_TRANS_WRITE...)
Function called on transfer completion/failure
Data passed back to the transfer completion callback

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t ep, uint8_t *data, size_t dlen, unsigned int flags)
memberdef.name: usb_transfer_sync

briefdescription.para: Start a transfer and block-wait for completion.

detaileddescription.para: Synchronous version of usb_transfer, wait for transfer completion before returning.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Pointer to data buffer to write-to/read-from
Size of data buffer
Transfer flags

simplesect.para: number of bytes transferred on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Cancel any ongoing transfer on the specified endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

briefdescription.para: Cancel all ongoing transfers.
Check that transfer is ongoing for the endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: true if transfer is ongoing, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Start the USB remote wakeup procedure.

detaileddescription.para: Function to request a remote wakeup. This feature must be enabled in configuration, otherwise it will always return -ENOTSUP error.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail, i.e. when the bus is already active.

briefdescription.para: Get status of the USB remote wakeup feature.

simplesect.para: true if remote wakeup has been enabled by the host, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: USB device core layer APIs and structures.

detaileddescription.para: This file contains the USB device core layer APIs and structures.
